description.narrative: The Somaliland Communities Resilience Enhancement (SCORE) program addresses the severe water shortage of communities in Eastern Somaliland who suffer during recurrent droughts. This project will rehabilitate water points such as shallow wells, roof catchments for institutions, and sub-surface tanks (berkads) to increase capacity for harvesting and storing water. Training water user committees and hygiene and sanitation committees to manage the water sources within the community and enhance positive behavior change for better health will be an essential accompaniment. A new disaster risk reduction component uses the Participatory Assessment of Disaster Risk (PADR) tool to help communities identify drought-related vulnerabilities and then design action plans to mitigate the same.

• Rehabilitate 11 berkads (sub-surface water reservoirs)
• Rehabilitate 14 shallow wells
• Develop roof catchment systems for five schools
• Form and train 14 community hygiene and sanitation committees
• Form and train 5 school hygiene and sanitation committees
• Assist in formation of Water User Committee (WUC) and conduct trainings in group management, leadership and communication skills, Operation and Maintenance (O&M), sanitary surveys, financial management and bookkeeping, conflict resolution, environmental sanitation and community mobilization methods
• Train 25 school teachers in each of the four regions (100 teachers total) in climate change adaptation and DRR
• Expose 100 children in each of 40 schools to the same message, for a total of 4000 direct beneficiaries
• Target the five schools reached with hygiene messaging with training in climate change issues and necessary behavior change
